result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason C Vollriede was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid within 60 days; alternate 10 days jail.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason C Vollriede

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 12/14/16 received a letter from DOA-Collections - Jason C Vollriede passed away 9/18/16 - no estate or beyond claim.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Jason C Vollriede in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Information filed. Reading waived.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.

Court orders the following:
Ct. 1:
- Fine totaling $473.50 to be paid in 60 days; alternate 10 days jail
Plea/sentencing hearing at 09-14-2015 10:30 am

Defendant Jason C Vollriede in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has completed AODA counseling and parenting classes. Defense requests a date in 3 weeks for plea/sentencing. Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on August 26, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Jason C Vollriede in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense has an offer. AODA treatment has been completed. Defendant needs to complete parenting classes. Defense requests another date for a hearing. Court grants request. Defense to advise on the next date how this matter will proceed - trial or plea.  Hearing scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Hearing on August 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Defendant Jason C Vollriede in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 25, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Jason C Vollriede in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Hearing on May 26, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Request for adjournment filed by defendant/defense counsel
Hearing on May 19, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jason C Vollriede in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant needs more time to get counsel and is requesting adjournment to get counsel and complete his AODA counseling. Court grants. Time limits are tolled.  Hearing scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on March 30, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Jason C Vollriede in court.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is requesting more time to hire counsel. Court grants and the time limits are tolled for the status of counsel. Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Hearing on February 23, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Jason C Vollriede in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.   Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing for the status of counsel or the status of the defendant getting into a counseling program.  Hearing scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 08:15 am.
